content: The topic of this article **may not meet Wikipedia's notability guideline for biographies**. Please help to demonstrate the notability of the topic by citing reliable secondary sources that are independent of the topic and provide significant coverage of it beyond a mere trivial mention. If notability cannot be shown, the article is likely to be merged, redirected, or deleted. *Find sources:* "Ashraf Safdar" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2015)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Ashraf Safdar** (born 29 February 1980) is a former [television presenter](/wiki/Television_presenter) and [journalist](/wiki/Journalist) from [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). He hosted the [talk show](/wiki/Talk_show) *Singapore Talking* on [MediaCorp Channel 5](/wiki/Channel_5_(Singaporean_TV_channel)) in 2010, and served as a judge on the [International Emmy Award](/wiki/International_Emmy_Award#International_Emmys)-nominated first season of Channel 5's *[The Arena](/wiki/The_Arena_(TV_series))* in 2007. Once a MediaCorp Overseas Scholar, he has also worked as a reporter for [Channel NewsAsia](/wiki/CNA_(TV_network)) and the *[Today](/wiki/Today_(Singapore_newspaper))* newspaper. A majority of his working life has been spent in wealth management, specifically private banking, and data-analytics. He is an alumnus of Harvard Business School, King's College London and the University of Chicago. This article about a Singaporean journalist is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Ashraf Safdar
